definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: The robberies have chilled the mah-jongg network.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案已经使麻将赌博网络胆战心惊。

sentences.english: It is a very simple case of robbery.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个很简单的抢劫案件。

sentences.english: Thursday's robbery was among the biggest heists in British history.
sentences.chinese: 周四的抢劫案是英国历史上抢劫价值最大的。

sentences.english: Does the new law relate only to robbery?
sentences.chinese: 这条新法律只涉及抢劫案件吗？

sentences.english: One of the largest jewel heists in history.
sentences.chinese: 又是史上一大珠宝抢劫案。

sentences.english: The police found a letter which implicated him in the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 察发现了一封信，这封信把他牵连到抢劫案中。

sentences.english: There was a hold-up at the bank over on 2nd street.
sentences.chinese: 在第二大街的银行里发生了一起抢劫案。

sentences.english: The bank was carefully cased by the bandits before the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 银行在抢劫案发生之前曾被匪徒彻底勘查过。

sentences.english: There have been several thefts and robberies in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这一地区发生了几起盗窃抢劫案件。

sentences.english: There was a holdup at the Morgan Trust Bank.
sentences.chinese: 摩根信托银行发生一起抢劫案。

sentences.english: There are several ripoff case in these zone .
sentences.chinese: 这一地区发生了几起盗窃抢劫案件。

sentences.english: Mike was art and part of the bank robbery.
sentences.chinese: 迈克煸动并参与了银行抢劫案。

sentences.english: They said this robbery keeps happening all these days.
sentences.chinese: 他们说最近这样的抢劫案在不断发生。

sentences.english: The police are hot on the trailof the mastermind behind the bank robbery.
sentences.chinese: 警察很快就要找到银行抢劫案的幕后操纵者了。

sentences.english: This policewoman’s job is to detect robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那个女警的任务是侦破抢劫案件。

sentences.english: B:Yeah, I report the robbery later.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，后来我报告了这起抢劫案。

definition: to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to commit a crime or offence
